snippet: For all China’s modern trappings, many experts say mutual wariness between the government and its citizens means the country still prefers to pay for things the old-fashioned way.
abstract: China, for all its modern trappings, still prefers to pay for things the old-fashioned way: with cash; experts say it is not a refusal to enter the 21st century as much as a reflection of the state of mutual wariness between country's government, which refuses to print large bills for fear of corruption, and its citizens, many of whom do not trust banks.

byline.contributor: Xu Yan contributed research in Shanghai.

lead_paragraph: For all China’s modern trappings, many experts say mutual wariness between the government and its citizens means the country still prefers to pay for things the old-fashioned way.
